{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3069021,"name":"Nehuel Armenanzas","username":"uncookednehuel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/uncookednehuel/{size}/167476_2.png","created_at":"2022-06-14T00:40:20.731Z","cooked":"

So I have installed a fresh installation of WPILIB on my personal home computer, and started working on a standard template project, when I realized I could not build the code. I have installed the swerve-lib, PathPlannerLib, and CTRE-Phoenix vendor libraries. I did have another existing version of visual studio code installed before installing WPILIB. I tried setting the default profile shell to command line, tried installing the JDK again, reinstalled WPILIB, and running the gradle build from an external command line. However I keep getting the same error

Executing task: gradlew build -Dorg.gradle.java.home=“C:\Users\Public\wpilib\2022\jdk” <

The terminal process failed to launch: Path to shell executable “cmd.exe” does not exist.

I am aware there is already a topic about this error, but it has closed without an explanation for the solution

Trying to build but missing cmd.exe? Java
cmd.exe itself shouldn’t be on the path, the folder containing cmd.exe (system32) should be. Note after editing it you need to restart vscode for it to see it.
Help Desk Geek – 26 Sep 17

How to Add to Windows PATH Environment Variable

If you're a coder or programmer, you probably spend a decent amount of time using the command prompt to execute programs or compile code. In order to complete those tasks, [...]

[The usual location for “cmd.exe” is normally something like: C:\Windows\System32.]
